summary: Beer is a popular alcoholic drink made from fermented cereal grains, usually barley. The starches in the grains are turned into alcohol and carbonation during fermentation. Hops are commonly used to add flavor and act as a preservative. Beer has a long history, with early writings mentioning its production. It's typically served in bottles, cans, or on tap at pubs. The alcohol content is usually between 4-6%. Beer is a big part of many cultures, with events like beer festivals and pub traditions.
title: Beer
